body: Thans a lot for reviewing jonatack! Force-pushed with your suggested changes.
Rebased on master and added suggested changes by jonatack (only sort expected invs once, use correct terminology regarding noban permission terminology).

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19674 (refactor: test: use throwaway _ variable for unused loop counters by theStack)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Rebased.
re-ACK ea74a3c per `git range-diff ce3bdd0e 2d43d84 ea74a3c`
Thanks for reviewing Marco. Force-pushed with your suggestions and a small log-message change proposed by jonatack  previously (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19564#discussion_r465517818).
code review ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19564/commits/9e7894357e296dbe0be775e1527654729dbb71b0
re-ACK 9e78943 per `git range-diff 3ab2582 ea74a3c 9e78943`

diff_hunk:
@@ -88,24 +88,22 @@ def test_feefilter(self):
 
         conn = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(TestP2PConn())
 
-        # Test that invs are received by test connection for all txs at
-        # feerate of .2 sat/byte
+        self.log.info("Test that txs paying .2 sat/byte are being received by test connection")
         node1.settxfee(Decimal("0.00000200"))
         txids = [node1.sendtoaddress(node1.getnewaddress(), 1) for x in range(3)]
         assert allInvsMatch(txids, conn)
         conn.clear_invs()
 
-        # Set a filter of .15 sat/byte on test connection
+        self.log.info("Set a fee filter of .15 sat/byte on test connection")
body:
I think you can leave this line as a code comment instead of logging it.

For the logging in general, would you mind prefixing the decimal values with 0? e.g. s/.15/0.15/

This is personal taste, so feel free to ignore, but I think it's unnecessarily verbose to add "that" after "Test..."

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,12 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
+        def invs_match():
+            return sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs)
body: could inline this with a lambda?

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,12 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
body: perhaps call this `assert_invs_match` or `wait_for_invs_to_match`

diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,9 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         # rounding down 3 places, leading to stranded transactions.
         # See issue #16499
         self.extra_args = [["-minrelaytxfee=0.00000100", "-mintxfee=0.00000100"]] * self.num_nodes
+        # whitelist all peers to speed up tx relay / mempool sync
+        for args in self.extra_args:
+            args.append("-whitelist=noban@127.0.0.1")
body: could just inline this arg with the others and put the comment above line 59

         assert allInvsMatch(txids, conn)

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,12 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
+        def invs_match():
+            return sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs)
body:
Before I had done it using a lambda and an assignment, the the following way:
```
invs_match = lambda: sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs)
test_framework.wait_until(invs_match, timeout=60, lock=mininode_lock)
```
but then flake8 would give the following error:
`p2p_feefilter.py:41:9: E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def`

Directly using the lambda on place of the parameter of `wait_until` works though, done.

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,12 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
body: Done, I chose `wait_for_invs_to_match`.

diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,9 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         # rounding down 3 places, leading to stranded transactions.
         # See issue #16499
         self.extra_args = [["-minrelaytxfee=0.00000100", "-mintxfee=0.00000100"]] * self.num_nodes
+        # whitelist all peers to speed up tx relay / mempool sync
+        for args in self.extra_args:
+            args.append("-whitelist=noban@127.0.0.1")
body: Done.

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,10 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs_to_match(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
+        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs),
body:
I wonder if we can eek some more perf by memoizing (untested):
```suggestion
        expected_txinvs = sorted(invs_expected)
        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: sorted(self.txinvs) == expected_txinvs),
```

diff_hunk:
@@ -61,7 +54,9 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         # mempool and wallet feerate calculation based on GetFee
         # rounding down 3 places, leading to stranded transactions.
         # See issue #16499
-        self.extra_args = [["-minrelaytxfee=0.00000100", "-mintxfee=0.00000100"]] * self.num_nodes
+        # whitelist all peers to speed up tx relay / mempool sync
body: Sorry I didn't notice this earlier; I think we're now starting to call this s/whitelist all/grant noban permission to/ (or something similar)

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,10 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs_to_match(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
+        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs),
body: Yes, that makes sense to do the sorting of the txinvs to test for only once. Did it with in-place sort of the passed list.

diff_hunk:
@@ -88,24 +84,22 @@ def test_feefilter(self):
 
         conn = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(TestP2PConn())
 
-        # Test that invs are received by test connection for all txs at
-        # feerate of .2 sat/byte
+        self.log.info("Test txs paying 0.2 sat/byte are being received by test connection")
         node1.settxfee(Decimal("0.00000200"))
         txids = [node1.sendtoaddress(node1.getnewaddress(), 1) for x in range(3)]
-        assert allInvsMatch(txids, conn)
+        conn.wait_for_invs_to_match(self, txids)
         conn.clear_invs()
 
-        # Set a filter of .15 sat/byte on test connection
+        # Set a fee filter of 0.15 sat/byte on test connection
         conn.send_and_ping(msg_feefilter(150))
 
-        # Test that txs are still being received by test connection (paying .15 sat/byte)
+        self.log.info("Test txs paying 0.15 sat/byte are being received by test connection")
body: c063dce9 nit: if you have to retouch, can remove "being" here and in line 87.

diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +37,11 @@ def on_inv(self, message):
             if (i.type == MSG_TX) or (i.type == MSG_WTX):
                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs_to_match(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
+        invs_expected.sort()
+        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: invs_expected == sorted(self.txinvs),
body: why not self.wait_until?

diff_hunk:
@@ -61,7 +55,9 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         # mempool and wallet feerate calculation based on GetFee
         # rounding down 3 places, leading to stranded transactions.
         # See issue #16499
-        self.extra_args = [["-minrelaytxfee=0.00000100", "-mintxfee=0.00000100"]] * self.num_nodes
+        # grant noban permission to all peers to speed up tx relay / mempool sync
+        self.extra_args = [["-minrelaytxfee=0.00000100", "-mintxfee=0.00000100",
+                            "-whitelist=noban@127.0.0.1"]] * self.num_nodes
body: would be nice to either put all in one line or each in one new line

diff_hunk:

                 self.txinvs.append(hashToHex(i.hash))
 
+    def wait_for_invs_to_match(self, test_framework, invs_expected):

+        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: invs_expected == sorted(self.txinvs),
body:
Good idea, this makes the code a lot shorter -- `test_framework` doesn't have to be passed to the inv-wait function and also setting the lock parameter is not needed anymore.
Done.
